image.altText: Snowy Mountains in NSW of snow on ground and rocks overlooking horizon with clouds in sky

props.synopsis: Through early next week much of the south-east will wake to temperatures near freezing, and along the ranges minimums should plunge to around -5 degrees Celsius.

title.children: Frigid start to winter for south-east states as Melbourne shivers through coldest day in five years

image.altText: Wests Tigers fans in front of the Leichhardt Oval scoreboard during an NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Albanese government has announced a $20 million investment into the historic Leichhardt Oval in Sydney's Inner West. The investment includes $10 million from the NSW government and $10 million from the local council.

title.children: Sydney's Leichhardt Oval to receive joint $40 million investment

image.altText: A Palestinian child sits on top of a pile of matresses on a road.

props.synopsis: The United Nations adds Israel's armed and security forces, Hamas and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group along with the Sudanese Armed Forces and rival paramilitary group Rapid Support Forces for the first time to its list of offenders for violating children's rights.

title.children: Israel's armed forces and Hamas are now on a UN global list of offenders that harm children

image.altText: Boxes of Mifeprisone tablets are stacked on top of each other on a shelf

props.synopsis: The unanimous decision is the first on abortion since Supreme Court justices overturned Roe vs Wade.

title.children: US Supreme Court strikes out bid to restrict access to abortion pill

image.altText: An iPhone shows various apps against a black background.

props.synopsis: There are growing calls for a ban on children accessing social media, with support on both sides of politics, but experts are divided.

title.children: Social media age limits might be popular with politicians and parents, but experts warn they aren't simple

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu graphic

props.synopsis: The evidence suggests the Greens' claims of a "two-way arms trade" between Australia and Israel is in fact one-way, with Australia importing but not exporting lethal technology from Israel.

title.children: Is Australia sending arms to Israel? No, but imports of Israeli weapons continue

image.altText: A man holding a beer wearing a flower hat

props.synopsis: Seven women read their victim impact statements out in court after Andrew Thomas Hayler uploaded digitally altered photographs of them to sexually explicit websites.

title.children: Close friend of bartender whose photos he manipulated for sexually graphic websites speaks of 'shock'

image.altText: Kaylee McKeown pushes over the lane rope

props.synopsis: Kaylee McKeown has nudged the world record to the point of it wobbling precariously on the mantelpiece three times in three different events at the Australian Swimming Trials. And that's great news for Paris.

title.children: Kaylee McKeown 'sharpening the axe' for Paris assault after hat-trick of near misses

image.altText: A sign for a community meeting is posted on a fence.

props.synopsis: A new report finds that by 2030, more than 3 million Australian homes could have exposure to some level of riverine flooding and it could leave home owners in precarious financial positions.

title.children: Thought it was already hard to get a mortgage? New flood modelling is expected to make that even worse

image.altText: Four women stand in coats and winter jackets outside on a sunny day in a city setting. Three are wearing facemasks

props.synopsis: Women in Japan face a $4,800 fine if they have a sterilisation procedure without their spouse's consent, but there is now a fight to have that changed.

title.children: These women want to be sterilised — they have to fight the law, their country, family and history

image.altText: A woman looks down on her work documents with a frown

props.synopsis: Going for a run, socialising, and learning a new hobby – a new research study aims to find out how Australians are recovering from their daily work stresses.

title.children: 'People are more exhausted than ever': New research aims to find out how Australians are recovering from work

image.altText: An unidentified scout's neckerchief from behind.

props.synopsis: The civil case heard the victim suffered serious psychiatric injuries at the hands of John William Alcorn.

title.children: Man who was abused by Scout leader when he was five awarded $1 million in damages

image.altText: An injured Queensland State of Origin stands around his teammates after a game.

props.synopsis: Brisbane coach Kevin Walters says Reece Walsh is making good progress with concussion protocols and will be fit for Queensland in game two of State of Origin.

title.children: 'Billy will select him': Kevin Walters says Reece Walsh on track for Origin

image.altText: A court sketch of a man in a court room

props.synopsis: The lover of a heavily pregnant Perth woman is found guilty of her murder after a seven-week trial during which it was suggested four other people, including his wife, could have been responsible.

title.children: Perth man found guilty of murdering heavily pregnant lover after seven-week trial

image.altText: A hand wearing a blue rubber glove holding a small tin full of pouches.

props.synopsis: Nicotine pouches are illegal in Australia, but they've been seized in alarming quantities since the federal government's ban on single-use vapes. Here's why the small sachets have authorities worried.

title.children: Are nicotine pouches the next vape? Authorities warn Australia is being flooded with them

image.altText: A young woman faces the camera in traditional cream and red Maori dress

props.synopsis: Mary Mercedes Lea'aeto forged the woman's signature on withdrawal forms multiple times over a nine-month period in what prosecutors labelled a "calculated" crime.

title.children: Former ANZ teller jailed over 'despicable' $56k theft from pensioner

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Judge Michael Croucher tells the jury that the only charges to be considered are the alleged murders of two Victorian campers, Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: Judge says deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill cannot be ruled manslaughter in Greg Lynn trial

image.altText: Chelsea player Sam Kerr in a jacket, holding a bottle, walking on the pitch before a match

props.synopsis: Matildas superstar captain Sam Kerr has re-signed with Chelsea until 2026 as she attempts to add more silverware to her trophy-laden time with the English powerhouse.

title.children: Matildas captain Kerr signs extension with Chelsea

image.altText: Presenter Paul Barry

props.synopsis: The show's longest-serving host will finish up in December this year.

title.children: Paul Barry steps away from Media Watch after 11 years as host

image.altText: A white, modernist, flat-fronted building with "supreme court" in capital letters above a wide entrance.

props.synopsis: The manager of the bottle shop where 20-year-old Declan Laverty was fatally stabbed while at work has told the NT Supreme Court employees were taught to "de-escalate" potentially violent situations and were not permitted to carry their own knives.

title.children: BWS employees not permitted to carry knives at work, trial of man accused of murdering bottle shop worker hears

image.altText: a woman looking ahead and talking

props.synopsis: Chris Dawson is serving a maximum 24-year jail sentence for the murder of his first wife, Lynette Simms, more than four decades ago.

title.children: Chris Dawson loses appeal over conviction for murdering wife Lynette Simms in the 1980s

image.altText: NSW Police

props.synopsis: A 92-year-old man suffered a fracture to his right elbow, and significant bruising to his head and arms after police attended a home in Picton following reports of a domestic incident.

title.children: Two police officers charged with assault after 92yo man injured at home in south-west Sydney

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A study ranking nearly 100 cities in eight countries places Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Perth among the world's least affordable cities to buy a home.

title.children: Housing is 'impossibly unaffordable' in Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide, and 'severely unaffordable' elsewhere

image.altText: A middle-aged man wearing a cap smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: NSW Police are appealing for information about the suspicious death of surfer, Guy Haymes. Mr Haymes was assaulted inside a Manly unit in February of this year and later died in hospital.

title.children: 'We can't imagine anyone would want to hurt him': Police appeal after surfer bashed to death in Sydney

image.altText: Man in white cap.

props.synopsis: A New South Wales man has been sentenced to nine years in jail for the shooting death of another man in Newcastle.

title.children: Shooter 'sorry to all those hurt' after drug debt argument ends in death

image.altText: Emily Seebohm stands in front of a bright light

props.synopsis: Emily Seebohm says she wants to show that it's possible for new mums to achieve their dreams after becoming mothers.

title.children: Emily Seebohm aims to prove 'it's possible to not only have kids but achieve your dreams too'

image.altText: A woman wearing a jacket and scarf smiles.

props.synopsis: The government has announced $22 million for design and construction of the centre a new health centre in Casey, something some locals say is badly needed.

title.children: Moira travels outside the ACT for specialist care — she says change is needed

image.altText: Teal PMs Allegra Spender, Monique Ryan, Sophie Scamps, Kylea Tink, Kate Chaney and Zali Steggall at a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is taking a gamble that people are more worried about paying their bills than solving the climate crisis. It's high-stakes poker, in which he hopes his plan can flush out the teals and win back Liberal votes.

title.children: Some say Dutton's high-stakes gamble has cleared the way for another teal wave, but he's betting on a different outcome

image.altText: A group of graduates.

props.synopsis: Migration added just over 100,000 people to Australia's population in the last three months of 2023, according to new official figures that cast doubt on the government's own migration forecast.

title.children: Migration numbers drop a little but not as much as the government expected

image.altText: A man, Brett Button, standing in a crowd of people with news cameras surrounding him

props.synopsis: Special court provisions will be needed for the sentencing of Hunter bus crash driver Brett Andrew Button, given the number of victims and families expected to attend.

title.children: Judge rules Hunter Valley bus crash driver must be in court to hear 35 victim impact statements

image.altText: Blurred photo of an older man wearing red and black cap and check shirt stands near a near trophy board. Slight smile.

props.synopsis: Douglas Thrift died from strychnine toxicity, but a coroner has found there is not enough evidence to prove how he ingested the poison.

title.children: Mystery remains as coroner unable to determine how farmer consumed poison that killed him

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis: The Australian Competition and Consumer Commission says a proposed merger between pharmacy retail giant Chemist Warehouse and Sigma Healthcare raises "competition concerns" in the country's pharmacy sector.

title.children: ACCC warns Chemist Warehouse's $8.8 billion merger could lead to higher prices and less competition

image.altText: Bear breaks in to car in Canada

props.synopsis: An Ontario woman is left with a hefty repair bill after a bear breaks into her car, rips the upholstery apart, and then falls asleep.

title.children: Wild black bear takes 'revenge' against Canadian car owner
